text: Tiger Woods took questions Sunday for
the first time since his private
indiscretions led to a very public
unraveling ESPN's Tom Rinaldi spoke with
woods it was a five-minute interview he
could ask anything that he wanted and
here's what Tiger says about that night
in November that started it all I've
done some pretty bad things in my life
and all came to a head but now after
treatment going for inpatient treatment
for 45 days and in more outpatient
treatment I'm getting back to my old
roots for a lot of people the spark of
those bad things is November 27th early
that day what happened well us all in a
police report you know beyond that
everything's between Elin and myself and
that's private why did you lose control
of the car and I said that's between you
and myself if it's a private matter
why issue a public apology a lot of
people an apology I heard a lot of
people not just my wife
my friends my colleagues the public kids
who looked up to me there were a lot of
people that thought I was a different
person and my actions were we're not
according to that and that's why I had
to apologize you said you've made
transgressions
how would you when your own words
describes the depth of your infidelity
well just one is is enough and obviously
that wasn't the case and I made my
mistakes
why not seek treatment before all of
this came out why I didn't know I was
that bad I didn't know I was that bad I
was living alone how did you learn I'm
stripping the white denial
rationalization you strip all that away
and you find the truth you said you were
in treatment the simple question is for
what that's the private matter as well
but I can tell you what it's it was
tough it was really tough to look at
yourself and a light that you never want
to look at yourself that's pretty brutal
what you see I saw a person that I never
thought I would ever become
who was that well I've gotten away from
my core values as I said earlier I got
away from my Buddhism and I quit
meditating I quit doing all the things
that my mom dad had taught me and as I
said earlier in my statement I felt
entitled and that is not how I was
raised
given all that's happened what's your
measure of success at Augusta well
playing is one thing I'm excited to get
back and play I'm excited to get to see
the guys again
I really missed a lot of my friends out
there I'm miss competing but still I
still have a lot more treatment to do
and just because I'm playing doesn't
mean I'm gonna stop going to treatment
what reception are you expecting from
fans I don't know I don't know I'm a
little nervous about that and to be
honest with you even that's how much do
you care it would be nice to hear a
couple collapse here there but also hope
there's also clouds for birdies to 11
months ago here at Iowa I asked you how
well does the world know you what's your
answer to that now a lot better now I
was living a life of a lie I really was
and I was doing a lot of things as I
said that hurt a lot of people and
stripping away denial and
rationalization you started coming to
the truth of who you really are and that
can be very ugly but then again when you
face it and you can start conquering it
and you start living up to it the
strength that I feel now I've never felt
that type of strength in the last four
months Tiger what's been the low point
I've had a lot of low points just what I
think I didn't think I could get lower I
got lower an example where that was in
treatment out of treatment before I went
in I mean there were so many different
low points people I had to talk and face
like like my wife
like my mom what was that moment like
either one they both have been brutal
they both look very tough because I've
hurt them the most and those are the two
people in my life who I'm the closest to
and that is to say the things that I
have done truthfully to them
Arcee was you know very painful what was
your wife's reaction when you sat down
and had that first conversation she was
hurt very hurt shocked
angry and you know I she had every right
to be and I'm as disappointed as
everyone else in my own behavior because
I can't believe I should did that to the
people I loved I asked this question
respectfully but of course at a distance
from your family life when you look at
it now why did you get married why cuz I
loved her I love dealing with everything
I have and that's something that makes
me feel even worse that did this to
someone I love that much how do you
reconcile what you've done with that
love we work at it yes pens Tom Rinaldi
joins us now live along with Howard
Bragman CEO of 15 minutes public
relations and ABC News sports
contributor Christine Brennan good to
have you all with us this morning of
course want to start with Tom first you
have interviewed Tiger many times over
the years not under these circumstances
you were limited to five minutes had to
be standing you could ask whatever you
wanted just overall your impressions of
Tiger when you talked to him yesterday
Tom well Robin I know you've had the
opportunity to speak with Tiger Woods
herself in different settings he came in
he was composed he was very cordial with
me and the crew there was no entourage
around him he was accompanied only by a
spokesman Glenn Greenspan but in that
moment before we actually rolled that
was where you could see the weighed upon
him of what he had been enduring in the
four months and obviously we chose to
ask him the questions that we did and we
don't want to suggest at all that he's
answered all the questions Robin there
are still many more that many other
people wish to ask him and can you tell
us a timing why now why did he decide to
to answer some questions now
I really couldn't speculate on why he
and his camp made that decision and made
this opportunity available but you could
suggest it after having made the public
statement Robin and then making public
the decision to go to Augusta to play
the Masters to try to diffuse some of
the questions that he may face when he
arrives there so that he may be able to
focus a bit more on the competition
itself I know
being that the masters period is just
challenging without all this all right
I'm gonna let you weigh in now you have
all along said the tiger needs a
game-changer is this it it's not
unfortunately it was it was not in the
right direction but but merely a nod it
again too little too late you know when
Tiger made himself vulnerable when he
really looked at himself and
acknowledged his mistakes and the people
he hurt in his family that's when he
starts to repair the damage that's when
he starts to get the sympathy of people
and I don't know why he wanted to limit
it to five minutes he was standing up
like he couldn't wait to run away from
this interview Robin it was almost you
know was almost bizarre he needs to
really sit down and have that cathartic
moment again this was a start but this
wasn't it he did answer all of Tom's
questions but sometimes when dealing
about what happened that night back in
November he said it's a private matter
he did fall back on that a little bit
does he has he said enough Howard you
know saying it's between Elin and myself
that's what we call pleading the fifth
and PR terms basically I don't think he
has said enough I don't think he said
enough to change the dialogue out there
I think people want to like him I think
we're a very forgiving country and a
very forgiving people but we want him to
to get in those spotlights and we want
to see him answer those questions before
we're going to go all the way and stand
by his side again so he's starting
robbing and and I'm glad he talked to
somebody finally after so many months
but he needs to sit down with you for
for 20 minutes and really get into it he
also talked to the golf channel
yesterday Christine before I ask you a
question I want to play a clip of that
interview with the Golf Channel because
he he was asked about his children take
a look how will you explain this to your
children one day when they're old enough
yeah we'll have that sit-down talk it
won't be just one time I know that it'll
be numerous times and I take full
ownership of it I did it no one else did
it was just me and that's the
responsibility I will have I will talk
to my kids for however long they want to
talk about it that is a conversation
that that will need to be had Christine
you saw both interviews just overall
your impressions and the fact that Tiger
you know he did talk about more personal
things than he has in the past he did
Robin and he was more real than he was
back in February during that public
statement his speech I think that's a
start for him you know but he's still a
control freak isn't he you know here he
has Tom there and it's five minutes and
then the Golf Channel five minutes and
Tom did a great job in those five
minutes mhm but but that's you know
that's Tiger wanting to be kind of
in-your-face I'm still on top of this so
I think again the same question still
exists how much has he changed again
it's his right to say it's a private
matter but he did go back to that
several times why Tom's great question
about if it if you it was private well I
have a public apology so there are lots
of things for those of us who are
covering the Masters to continue to want
to ask him including the
performance-enhancing drug issue that I
know Tom would have liked to get you but
of course didn't have time for all of
that
yes that's indeed in five minutes he did
get a lot in Tom you did in that short
period of time but never enough time for
Christine Howard and Tom thank you both
all all three of you for joining us this
morning and I'm sure we will continue
the conversation until the Masters takes
place in a couple of weeks thank you all
